MUI Minta Pemerintah Kurangi Bicara Radikalisme
07 Nov 2019, 11:07 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Majelis Ulama Indonesia (MUI) menilai pembahasan mengenai bahaya paham radikalisme sudah mencapai level berlebihan. Menurut MUI, masih banyak persoalan bangsa yang harus diperhatikan.
"Imbauan kepada pemerintah dan media, mengingat masalah-masalah yang dihadapi bangsa ini sangat banyak, maka kita mengharap kepada pihak pemerintah dan media agar mengurangi dosis pembicaraan tentang radikalisme. Karena apa yang ada selama ini terasa sudah melebihi dosis dan proporsinya," kata Sekjen MUI Anwar Abbas dalam pesan tertulis, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Anwar meminta intensitas pembahasan radikalisme ditekan. Menurut dia, banyak masalah yang dampaknya tak kalah dahsyat, yaitu terkait ekonomi, politik, dan pendidikan.
"Oleh karena itu, kita meminta supaya dosis pembicaraan tentang radikalisme ini dikurangi dan atau dikempeskan. Ini bukan berarti bahwa masalah radikalisme tidak penting dan tidak berbahaya bagi masa depan bangsa, tapi persoalan yang dihadapi bangsa ini tidak hanya masalah radikalisme," jelas Anwar.
"Masih banyak persoalan-persoalan lain yang harus kita perhatikan dan pikirkan, yang dampak dan bencana serta malapetaka yang akan ditimbulkannya juga tidak kalah besar dan bahkan bisa lebih dahsyat, kalau tidak bisa kita respon dan antisipasi secara serius dan sungguh-sungguh," sambung dia.

MUI Asks Government to Reduce Talks on Radicalism
Nov 7 2019, 11:07 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Indonesian Ulema Council (MUI) assesses that discussions on the dangers of radicalism have reached excessive levels. According to MUI, there are still many national issues that must be considered.
"Appeals to the government and the media, given the problems faced by this nation very much, then we expect the government and the media to reduce the dose of talk about radicalism. Because what is available so far seems to have exceeded the dose and proportion," said the Secretary General of the Indonesian Ulema Council Anwar Abbas in a written message on Thursday (11/07/2019).
Anwar asked that the discussion on radicalism be suppressed. According to him, there are many problems whose impact is no less terrible, namely related to economics, politics, and education.
"Therefore, we ask that the dose of talk about radicalism be reduced and / or reduced. This does not mean that the problem of radicalism is not important and is not dangerous for the future of the nation, but the problems faced by this nation are not only about radicalism," explained Anwar.
"There are still many other issues that we must pay attention to and think about, the impacts and disasters and the disasters they will cause are also no less massive and can be even more devastating, if we cannot respond and anticipate seriously and seriously," he continued .
